comments: Professor Kassel-Kerson is very kind, understanding, and coherent. Her lectures are heavy and she does NOT post the PowerPoints to blackboard. She gave the class several opportunities for extra credit (totaling about 15-20 points), so don\'t worry if you don\'t do so well on the midterm/final. It is a very fair class and she is a very fair professor.

stu_tags: CARING  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GET READY TO READ
comments: She is very particular with what she wants, but you can build up your grade. I thought I wasn\'t going to do too well, but I ended up receiving a grade of an A. Overall, if you ask for her advice she gives it, and she\'s very kind and caring. If you\'re going to take her, be prepared for a lot of work, but don\'t overly scare yourself.

comments: The class is very easy if you do all of the assignments. For example, she gave perfect scores to every who presented, even the people who were clearly unprepared. If you get to class early she will talk about politics. Attendance was recorded but doesn\'t affect your grade. Overall she is very nice and more than fair.

stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  EXTRA CREDIT  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: It\'s very self-taught. She gives review sheets in advance which help immensely. Overall there\'s 1 comparative paper, 1 quiz, 2 exams, an oral presentation & submit chapter notes weekly. Participation matters, but even if you\'re quiet like I am, it\'s fine, your work will speak for itself. Honestly not as daunting as it sounds, I would recommend it.

comments: Day 1 of this course it seemed like it was going to be extremely overwhelming and a lot of work. Stick through it though, it\'s a lot easier than it seems. She\'s an extremely nice professor. A lot of reading, but nothing difficult. The mid-term and final have I.D. questions where you have to remember a lot of specifics but if you study you\'re fine.

comments: By far, favorite class and favorite professor. She had around 53 students (in our class) and had quizzes, midterms and papers graded and by the next class! Shes hilarious and her love for Asian history really made me love Asian history too. Tons of extra credit which are very interesting. Would definitely take her again.

comments: I love her! She\'s an amazing professor and I honestly can say that this was my favorite course in all my years attending queens college. Her vast amount of knowledge of Asian history is mind blowing! Her class is fair, 1 midterm, 1 final and if I had a choice, I would take her class over and over again!

comments: Have to submit notes 10x, oral presentation, midterm, final, and final paper. Difficult class with a lot of information to memorize. Gave everyone points off for the midterm essay because one student used two blue books- making the standard. Also, she asked that no one post a bad review for her on ratemyprofessor.

comments: Wow. I simply don\'t have enough characters to explain. I have this professor for two classes this semester and she is by far the best and most intelligent professor I have yet to have in my college career. On top of that she is funny, nice and really easy to talk to. I adore Professor Kassel and intend to keep in touch after the semester is over!

comments: Midterm, Final, Final paper, and oral presentation. She is very by the book. If you want to ask her questions about the paper or tests or anything important, you need to ask in class otherwise she won\'t give you any information. You need the textbook for the first half of the semester where you have to hand in notes about the chapter.

comments: The material itself is not difficult. Just don\'t hold too many expectations. She\'s so passive aggressive and went out of her way on the day of the final review to make sure we didn\'t review. She\'s picky and it\'s either her way or the highway. Doesn\'t bother to let you take notes, and is stupidly confusing. Don\'t ruin your semester with this lady.

comments: She is tough. Expects participation, you say an awesome she doesn\'t agree with expect to be tongue lashed. I DO NOT, I DO NOT, I DO NOT RECOMMEND HER. Writing assignments are rigidly constructed and no room to show creativity. DONT TAKE HER UNLESS U LOVE WRITING ALOT AND ITS A SURVEY CLASS.

comments: Great professor! Super knowledgeable, approachable and helpful. Definitely not an easy A but totally worth it. She\'s great and truly knows her stuff. I would absolutely recommend her.

comments: She not only cares about Chinese hist and will make you care about it with her passion and knowledge, but she also cares about her students. She wants you to learn/better yourself so she won\'t do you the diservice of giving you an A that you haven\'t earned. Rather, she provides you with the tools you need to succeed both in and out of her class.
